website_summaries.verdict: A premium Ethernet switch from a globally recognized supplier of high-tech products.
pros: Can be set up without any software
Switch adjusts its power consumption on its own based on cable length and link status
Fanless, ensuring you won't have to worry about excessive noise
Easy to mount the switch to a wall
cons: Power adapter connector often comes loose
Doesn't allow you to modify or delete VLAN 1

customer_reviews.title: Got an 8 and 5 port for Gigapower
customer_reviews.text: I got an 8 port for behind my TV and a 5 port for my office and couldn't be happier. I got AT&T fiber and was only getting like 100 mbps over wifi which wasn't going to fly. I got an ethernet cable and wired up my PCs in the office and my xbox, ps4, smart tv, cable box, cloud drive, etc behind the tv and everything is getting close to the speed I am paying for. The PCS both get in the 900s and the xbox is getting around 800 mbps through these switches. I was going to get the more expensive ones but these ones work great! Why pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: I plugged this switch into a line from my router ...
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this switch into a line from my router and then plugged several devices into it. The hard wired devices will not work when wired through this switch, but all of them work when wired to the router directly. Also, as soon as I connect this box to the network it also makes all the wireless devices stop working. The wireless devices are still connected to a WiFi signal, but the connection itself flags as having no internet connection. Only solution is to disconnect this box from the network and reset both the modem and router.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Great to add Additional Ethernet Ports for College Dorm Room - Plug-and-Play
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link's 5-Port Gigabit Ethernet Switch is great for those situations where you have limited ethernet ports. As advertised, the unit is truly plug-and-play; plug the power cable into a wall outlet, connect an ethernet cable from the wall (LAN) to the switch, connect your other ethernet devices to the switch. My son's dorm room only has TWO ethernet ports (which were placed behind the desk); this ethernet hub allows him and his roommate to utilize the college's extremely fast ethernet network for their computers and smart TV versus the crowded and slow WIFI network. HUGE DIFFERENCE IN SPEED OVER WIFI
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota2k4

customer_reviews.title: Smokin'. Killer value.
customer_reviews.text: Man - gigabit is the bomb. Tested my previous netgear switch with cat 5 against this gigabit switch with amazon basics cat 6 cables. A 20+ seconds file transfer (cat 5) was done in 2.7 seconds (gigabit and cat 6). I'm not used to the latest-greatest performing like manufacturer claims - but man, that's an impressive speed bump for under 20 bucks! All my previous swicthes from this manufacturer have run forever, too. It's a no brainer for transfering files around the house or office.
customer_reviews.author: M. CarterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This switch is inexpensive and functions, but is definitely not something to be relied on for any kind of performance. It is easily overloaded by something as simple as copying a file and will get massive latency spikes. Forget copying a file and gaming or anything at all like that. You can't even copy a file and browse the internet at the same time without web pages taking literally 30 seconds to load. It's ridiculously easy to overload this switch and then everything you try to do online or over your network is completely hosed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little switch!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is super easy to install being unmanaged. I hooked up my switch via an extender in my upstairs bedroom. It is much smoother this way than with my router. I game alot and this little unit is an excellent addition to my home network.
customer_reviews.author: Alecs

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Inexpensive, Small form factor
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I work in IT at a small company and anytime we need a small switch so we can have 2 computers or a printer, NAS, or network camera, we always go with these. They're gigabit so we always have good throughput, I also like that the power adapter is very small, about the same size as a phone charger. It also runs perpendicular to the prongs so the other socket on the outlet can still be used. I added and access point at my house and decided to get one of these. It runs perfectly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Macklemore

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Google Wifi mesh 3 wireless point system. It works absolutely fantastic at covering the entire house in wonderful WiFi signal. The one drawback is that each WiFi point only has one Ethernet plug in. Well, I have a home security system, 2 wireless camera systems and a Wemo bridge that all require Ethernet connections. Enter this product. Connect one wireless point to this product and then all four products listed above also to this product and problem solved. Works as advertised, everything is up and running flawlessly and I still have open Ethernet jacks on my other two wireless points if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E.

customer_reviews.title: SMART? NOT REALLY
customer_reviews.text: It claims to have port prioritization but when using it I still see immediate high latency when other devices are on the other ports. If you are planning to buy this to prioritize a gaming system over something like Netflix users or other streamers in the house it's not going to help...Very disappointed. I am giving it two stars because for a basic switch it functions fine.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Joe

customer_reviews.title: Rating would be a five but I received old stock version 1 from 2018. Considering returning
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what hardware changes were made between v1, v1.2, v1.20 and v3 but I expected to get the latest version (3) since it was ship from and sold by Amazon directly not a 3rd party. Somewhat disturbing to get a unit with the latest firmware being Published Date: 2018-11-07. Version 3 does not have a firmware upgrade yet but the v1.20 latest firmware is Published Date: 2019-12-06. I am contacting TP-Link to find out what if any functional differences exist. I will update this review when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: image1

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all cost. Wont pass DHCP
customer_reviews.text: So, a simple dumb switch. Should be a simple easy device to use. Sadly, none of my devices I connect to it will pick up an ip address when booted up. I've swapped ports, checked my modem/router, no change. It will connect to the network, but gets no traffic. Sometimes rebooting the computer resolves it for that session, other times, not. Save your money for a better brand and model. And its out of the return window, so money wasted. should have stuck with my 15 year old D-link 10/100.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Constant Broadcast Packets; Servers Drop Packets
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Contacted TPLink support. After several back-n-forths, they instructed me to disable the 'Loop Detection' feature and that will stop the RRCP packets. This worked! Very happy they were able to find a solution. 5-stars now. ORIG: This switch uses the RealTek chipset which broadcasts out special packets every 2 seconds for the RRCP featureset of RealTek chips. Check wikipedia for RRCP description. Because these packets have no payload, our servers drop them which increases 'drop packet counters' which causes monitoring alarms to go off. TPLink tech support confirms no way to disable this "feature." Will probably end up returning it and going with a different manufacturer who doesn't embed these pointless packets.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B

customer_reviews.title: Works on 200Mbps download line 👍
customer_reviews.text: I have an older switch that was not cutting it in splitting the signal so was looking at a smaller but faster switch. This was to run the internet from the first floor with the Cat6 routed through the floor and into the basement that hooks up to the shed where we already had a network cable piped by an electrician. The speed is great and have not seen any ping issues or disconnects. The line has a goal of 200 ft or so from the source. Very compact and was easy to hide the box so very happy with it 😀
customer_reviews.author: AkiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gig switch
customer_reviews.text: Just changed internet providers and purchased my own router to avoid the monthly rental fees of their router. The one I picked up only has 2 Gigabit ports so purchased this TP-Link Gig switch to connect everything I had connected to the old router. I have purchased many TP-Link products in the past and like the others, this switch does not disappoint. It is well made with an all metal case and small form factor/footprint which saves space. Would recommend to anyone looking for a new switch.
customer_reviews.author: [Redacted] c

customer_reviews.title: Failed to provide POE to Unify device
customer_reviews.text: Seems this TP-Link 5-port unmanaged POE switch doesn't successfully negotiate POE to a Unify nano AP. Unify device failed to power up, even though the entire setup works using the Unify provided POE injector. Tried several different inputs on the TP-Link device, but nothing worked. Going back to using the Unify-provided POE injector, even though that means another power device in the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Peter O

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I just started working from home because of this COVID19. I brought my work computer home and put it in my home office/gaming space. My router is in another room though, so I either had to run another CAT6 cable from that, under my house over to that room (should have thoughth of that when I originally installed the cable), but I digress... I can run both PCs at the same time and I see no difference in internet speeds. I would buy again, I might even gift a couple to some people.
customer_reviews.author: M3rKn

customer_reviews.title: Tested internet speed after proper installation, MAX was 50 MBps, Internet Service is 150 MBps.
customer_reviews.text: Product Pluses 1- well made 2- easy to install *** Home Internet speeds tested when Hard Wired and WiFi between 120 MBPS to 148 MBPS Product NEGATIVES with Hard Wire Connection from TP-Link 5 Port #1 Issue, Home Internet Speed Tested, Hard Wired, MAX 47 MBPS, Successful Physical Reinstallation of Switch, 3 times, Hard Wired to TP-Link Gigabit Ethernet Switch ONLY, up to 47 MBPS with different ports. WiFi connection, up to 140 GBPS each reconnection. Under conditions, At various times of day. In ANY of the ports, Ethernet 5 10 OK Ethernet 5 100/MBPS unit FAILED Ethernet 5 1000/GBPS unit FAILED Overall Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works like you would expect.
customer_reviews.text: It connected at 1 gigabit to the gigabit switch upon plugin right from the start, it has remained connected at 1 gigabit consistently since then and is giving gigabit connection speeds to the systems connected to it. Files are transferring at 100 megabytes (a gigabit). Basically it is doing exactly what I wanted and doing it flawlessly. The case is metal not plastic. I would say the lights are about the right brightness, easy to see, but not blinding. The connections are solid and easy to access. They are somewhat close together and can be a pain to pull those covered Ethernet connectors out. But are not so recessed that they are inaccessible. All in all, a good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Big Blah (but it does work)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 3 year old 10/100/1000 Netgear switch. I was hoping it would be a little faster, but the tests show virtually no difference. The major problem for me is the aesthetics. It says it is a desk top switch. The front (or back) side is the power connection, and the other (back or front) side is the connectors and lights. Neither side is something I want to look at on my desk top. The Netgear switch has the connectors in the back along with the power cord. There are lights on the front to monitor activity. If it were more than $20 I'd return it. I'll see if a friend (or enemy) wants it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be any easier to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this network switch 5 stars simply for its ease of use. It arrived just two days after ordering (a big deal in COVID times). I took it out of the box, plugged it in, connected my two computers, and done! The whole experience took about 10 minutes. I've had it now for about two weeks and no issues to report. My devices have remained connected and everything is running smoothly. Seriously...could not be any easier!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Embardo

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better brand
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after half a year of use, no longer maintains connections and drops packets constantly, very unhappy with my purchase. I've worked in IT for 10 years, I understand sometimes it's luck of the draw with these products but for an unmanaged switch (dumb switch) I expected it to work without issues considering the simplicity of the PCB. This implies they cheaped out on components and ran the numbers to the bare possible minimum to maximize profit at the expense of their customers. We use TP-Link for many applications when a simple switch is needed and with this trend I'm seeing I'll be recommending other competitors to our business. Don't waste your money here.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryWizard

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from the 5 Port Switch
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned the TP-Link 5 port Switch (TL-SG105). Needed more ports. Big advantages are the lights on each port indicate if the port is operating at gigabit speed (green) or 10/100 Mbps speed (yellow). For a home network set up, this is a huge help in troubleshooting cables and connections. With a web gui opening up features and with a small price difference, not sure why I bought the five-port switch in the first place. For a price difference of less than $5, I would opt for the 8 port switch over the 5 port. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Risio

customer_reviews.title: Warning: this switch falters with 1Gb/sec connections
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine for 100mb/ssc. I upgraded to 1Gb/sec and the switch can only handle 1 device. This is the downside of an unmanaged cheap switch. TP Link tech support can’t diagnose. Even though, I only have had for this switch for 6 months, it’s non returnable. I definitely will not buy a TP Link switch and I don’t care if I pay more, I need the retailer to stand behind the product.
customer_reviews.author: davef0001

customer_reviews.title: Price + Metal Cage = Unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: I see these right next to the net gear ones. And if you're techy like me, you always just go with the netgear ones but the TP link ones are so much cheaper so this time I decided to just go with them. Netgear is like that name brand and TP is that up and coming, been here for a while brand. They pretty much copied netgear's switch. And it actually works perfectly. In a blind test, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference. I will be getting TP link's switches from now on. Why pay more for the same basic thing?
customer_reviews.author: Control Room 2020

customer_reviews.title: Power-hungry and VERY loud.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this switch to be able to run 3 POE+ cameras, in addition to just being a small-office, managed switch. It was supposed to replace our other TP-Link switch--which is POE but not POE+ capable. Unfortunately, this switch is VERY loud! It seems as though they used the lowest quality fans available, and subsequent online searching reveals that this is a well known issue. As we intend it to be situated in the workspace, and not a server closet, it has to go back. Also of particular note, this thing is a power-hog! Even when it's not connected to POE+ devices, it's pulling a constant 90+ watts (measured with 2 different Kill-A-Watt units.)
customer_reviews.author: book_nerd

customer_reviews.title: Wired from Satellite for stable connection
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have the Orbi Mesh system at how, Wi-Fi speed isn’t always top notch. With distance learning in full bloom, I don’t want to hear anymore desperate drop Zoom sessions. Wired this from an Orbi Satellite into the living room. Now the iMac and Chromebook and printer are all plugged into it. Internet seems to be faster and the only drop will be because router needs reset.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLife

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought three
customer_reviews.text: This network switch is so good I bought three to cover three major hubs in my home for great internet connectivity: 2 offices and 1 media center. The price point (about $16) is unbelievably good, which makes it almost too good to be true. Regular speed tests show consistently great results, even when all three are active via multiple devices/usage. I could not recommend this product more.
customer_reviews.author: hk stuff

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Have an Ethernet cable running from basement into this, andthen 2 coming out of it into my Xbox One & PC. Take it out of the box, plug in the power adapter. Plug the main Ethernet cable into any slot. Done. Internet speed has been better if anything since I’ve used it. I typically get up to 200 download. I tested my speed after using this and i was at 225 download/ 10 upload and 15 ping. Which is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Started failing after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I work remotely and this 5 port switch started having extremely poor performance after 6 weeks. Testing different ports, I see my download speed goes from 500+ Mbps down to 1-10 Mbps depending on which port I plug into. Sometimes it's the upload speed that gets killed depending on the port. And of course now I am just a few days outside the return window on Amazon. Definitely won't be buyiing TPLink again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd tp-link 5 port I had to take off the LAN. 1st one totally crashed/disabled entire LAN and no longer works. Network recovered upon removing this switch. 2nd one caused intermittent WAN failures (appeared as DNS lookup failure) on connected and next/previous stage switches and PCs Network recovered upon removing this switch. Though I might save a couple bucks on these cheap switches.. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Just plug it in and it works.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know a lot about networking, but I need both ethernet and wireless. Plug in the A/C adapter. Plug the ethernet (internet) cable into it (good instructions came with this) connect your computer and your wireless router to it. No problemo. Computer still gets gigabit signal and wireless router gets what it needs. It's cute, sits on the floor, and has dasblinkinlights.
customer_reviews.author: amy schechter

customer_reviews.title: 2 of the ports have degraded overtime.
customer_reviews.text: The switch worked great for the better part of 1 year. After a while, the 1st and 4th port started to crap out on me. TP-Link has been known to produce crappy units, and this one did not support. None of the ports were under heavy load. But it was only after actually hooking up 3 different PC's to the same switch where i saw throttling in the bandwidth. I eventually swapped the unit for a better switch and haven't looked back. This unit might be good for 2 PC's + consoles, but can't rely on it for anything that requires more bandwidth than that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Worked the second time around
customer_reviews.text: I received this 5 port switch because I have two computers at my desk that both need to be wired connections. The first package/item was defective but the replacement pkg received a day later works perfectly. I think the first package may have been sent to me in error because it didn't appear to have the same shrink wrap around it, and the gummies that stick under the switch to keep it from sliding were not in the first pkg but were in a little baggy in the second package. Either way, day one with new item, it works great and was really plug and play and ready to go. Exactly what I needed, even if a day late.
customer_reviews.author: Marizol Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and speedy
customer_reviews.text: This little devices is great if you need extra ports for hardwired devices. It delivers rock-solid connectivity and performance. To provide a little context on my setup, I have the following devices hardwired to the TP-Link and router: - Smart TV - Apple TV - Direct TV Box (TP-Link) - PS4 - Philips Hue Bridge (TP-Link) - Lutron Bridge (TP-Link) - AV Reciever (TP-Link) The bottom of the switch is relatively flat and it has mounting points to make cable organization easier. I used command strips (instead of the rubber feet provided) to mount the TP-Link to the back of the entertainment cabinet. Very happy with switch and would recommend if you need up to 4 extra ports.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: A perfectly small switch
customer_reviews.text: This switch is great when your router runs out of spare ethernet ports. I notice no extra latency from this switch and my gaming PC is plugged into it. it's plug and play so hook and ethernet end into a port in your router and the other one in the last port on this switch, plug it in and your off to the races. The only gripe/suggestion I got is I wish this switch had a usb power supply. The energy required to power this switch is so minimal it could be powered by any old USB port and be fine. This would save me from having to use an available outlet on my powerstrip.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas S. Harman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & affordable
customer_reviews.text: I love TPLink products. They have always been dependable.I had to replace a 24 port DLINK switch I had installed several years ago that I had forgot about - I had replaced all other DLINK devices last year - except for the one that recently failed. I had to order this one urgently to replace the failed DLINK. I will buy at least one more to have as a backup. I have never had an issue with these 24 port switches. I do not rack mount mine, but they come with hardware if you want to. I highly recommend TPLINK. Avoid Consumer grade DLINK.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, POE for later...
customer_reviews.text: We will likely add a PTZ camera, so having this device with POE is future-proofing our network at church. Plus the Gigabit rating is needed for use with NDI cameras. We already webcast at high network speeds, so the capabilities are best to future proof our simple ethernet network at church. With competing demands on the network bandwidth, it matches the 550 Mb/s of our fioptics network. Streaming a webcast doesn't tolerate contention for the bandwidth. So this device is one more piece that helps keep the network at peak performance by removing a potential bottleneck.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Champ
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a splitter like this. works like a champ as I stated in the headliner. Don't cheap out and get them little black splitters that go from 2 to 1 and back to 2 again for 8 bucks and some change, I tried it and it didn't work. Trust me do it right the first time and you will 8 bucks and a few days ahead.\ Highly Recommended !!!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: If you need additional Ethernet inputs this is what you need
customer_reviews.text: My cable company decided to UPGRADE me to a faster "Gateway" , Router, Modem, whatever you choose to call it. The problem is the so called upgraded "Gateway" only has TWO Ethernet inputs. The one it replaced had FOUR. I found this TP-Link 5 port Switch and it solved my problem. My cable company is trying to say that "wireless connections are faster". That may or may not be true, but they are not as secure as a Ethernet cable from my devices. This is an excellent switch for any device that has a Ethernet cable. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: It's acceptable for some use, but even then, inconsistently...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheaply priced basic switch to hook up 3 devices in my office with a 4th running to a Linksys Wifi router. For the most part I don't have a problem with this thing. Sometimes though, and sometimes frequently, it will lose connection to the internet. When it cuts out it's usually for about 30-40 seconds, then reestablishes itself. This problem can happen about 2-3x a week, or 2-3x a day. Devices in the house hardwired directly to the Linksys router or via it's wifi don't have this problem. It's only the ones going through this switch.
customer_reviews.author: WearyTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Good, Durable Metal Gigabit Box
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading to 500/500mbps internet speeds, I found out my old networking switch was a blazing fast 10/100mbps model. Not needing too many ports I decided to go with this model due to brand familiarity and the fact its an all metal shell and supported gigabit speeds. So far so good. Handles 2 PCs and a PS4 without issue. Seeing 450-500mbps (not bad as its about 25 feet away from the router) on speed tests. Small form factor means I can tuck it away as not worry about it as well. Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A simple but very good switch
customer_reviews.text: It's a basic switch but performs exceptionally well at network duties in a small office / home setting. With a minimal footprint and all metal construction, these TP-Link's feel robust and high quality compared to older plastic basic gear. After replacing a couple of fast ethernet switches with these gigabit versions, all of my devices are finally communicating at 1000 mbps. Internal network speeds are fantastic and I get my full 110 mbps ISP download througout. I have had excellent luck with TP-Link netowrking components over the years. Hopefully these switches will continue that legacy.
customer_reviews.author: MD90

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have enough power for longer cable runs
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these switches. Both worked fine with shorter patch cables of 6 ft. length. However, I also have a 50 ft. run of cat5e cable to bring gigabit ethernet to the other side of our house. Neither switch would work with its uplink connected to the end of the 50 ft. run coming from our gigabit router. The ports would not even light up. They should support cables up to 100m in length. So instead, I purchased a Linksys 5-port gigabit switch and it works just fine. Plug and play. Both of the TP-link switches are being returned.
customer_reviews.author: T. Quain

customer_reviews.title: Not 1000 Mbps when connecting 3 devices, will disconnect everything for a minute when adding a device.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this. It has the following problems: -When connecting only 2 devices, it will give the promised 1000 Mbps. But when you connect a third device, all the ports drop to 100 Mbps. -When you connect a new device, it will disconnect everything for around 1 minute. This will also happen if you turn on a device that was already connected. I'm thinking about getting a different switch.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hub for quite a while now with two Apple Macbooks. One is my primary working computer and the other I use for Zoom so I can see everyone while logged into a private network on the other laptop. I have both hardwired for both security and speed with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anne b.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable - Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of them to replace other switches I was using. Wanted to set up and link VLANs. I was able to get the VLANs working on the first switch with no problem but I could not get the VLAN to work on my second switch in a media cabinet where I wanted to isolate some IoT devices from my primary network. TP-Link's support people were helpful, but even though the configuration I wanted was possible according to them they could not get it to work so I ended up returned the second switch., I have always had good luck using TP-Link unmanaged switches which was why I decided to try the Easy Smart
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Duthie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but problem with Port 1
customer_reviews.text: Minus 1 star for Port 1. Have 2 TP-Link both have the same problem with Port 1. Is plug and play no tech involved. Plug into Port 1, it blink for a second and it stopped working. The other Ports are working fine. What are the odds received 2 devices have the same problem. Try again for the 3rd one let see what happen. I still like the device let's hope it will work the 3rd try. Update: 3rd TP-Link arrived and all 5 Ports are working. Time will tell if is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: It's small, efficient, and a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to give a non-techy review for those who are just looking for something to plug a computer, a printer, and maybe an XBOX (whatever) or Playstation (whatever) into. This is a great little desktop switch if you're a home tech, or or just want to be able to plug things in instead of going WiFi. I have it running next to my machine and barely notice it's there. It's an intelligent little switch, with no remote management needs. Just plug it in, add your devices, and it just works. Pros Small, fast, and efficient. Good price. Cons Doesn't make me coffee
customer_reviews.author: MrAltoids

customer_reviews.title: Watch the price.
customer_reviews.text: The switch is doing everything I need to split the Ethernet connection for my printers. I purchased this late July for $14.99. I need another but see the price fluctuate up from $14.99 original price to $17.99. Not sure why so much change in price; I guess it is becoming a commodity with at home work so everyone wants to make a few extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: ZenFam

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the easiest tech item to set up for a home network. You plug in the internet source, and the rest of the ports are for connecting to devices to use that internet connection. Don’t have to put the internet source into a special ethernet port, any one will do. Works flawlessly and very high throughput (I have AT&T Fiber and speed tests show almost a full 1 GB of throughput). No configurations, no software, no nothing! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: et

customer_reviews.title: Good for light usage but buckles under load
customer_reviews.text: The device provides gigabit speeds on speed tests, but can not handle negotiating multiple simultaneous connections. For instance if one port has a handful of transfers going, it could cause the other ports to drop traffic. I have a computer, a laptop, an IP phone, and a printer hooked up to this. If usage gets heavy I start getting dropped calls. I never had this problem before installing this device. The device I used prior to this had less bandwidth but performed better.
customer_reviews.author: A smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Solid, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I now have several of these little switches sprinkled about my household. They are simple to set up and reliable, and can be daisy-chained if needed (but not more than 3 in-a-row!). My local power is subject to regular flickers and occasional outages, but these switches have always held up well. The only time a switch got killed was by a power surge that fried every single surge protector in the house -- so no bad there! And, the price is certainly right. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Book Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Ports randomly shut off
customer_reviews.text: It's true what they say: you get what you pay for. This little switch should hide in the back of your networking cabinet to be forgotten about, but I've spent too much time trying to figure out why some of the ports turn themselves off after a while. Maybe it something to do with the managed power "feature", I don't know, but it doesn't matter because this thing is going back. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Astrodonkey

customer_reviews.title: Switch failed after 35 days of purchasing and installing it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Switch failed after 35 days of purchasing and installing it!!! I had to send everyone in the entire company home due to this failed switch because we could not connect to our server! Window for returning it was only 30 days, so I was not able get our $60 back for the purchase, which wasn't a big deal. The big deal was that we lost thousands of dollars because I had to send all the employees home due to the failed switch! Needless to say that we will never purchase a TP-LInk product again!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up, solid performance!
customer_reviews.text: For normal/typical home use, this 5 port switch is awesome. This brand is very reliable when it comes to networking gear and very well known. You literally plug in your ethernet cables and it'll work. There is no other setup is needed. I've tested downloading and uploading large files using a few ports in parallel but I observe no negative effect on the network. So for me, the model that lacks the managed network control no observable negative effect. In summary, if you are looking to connect a few devices (desktop, gaming console, media server etc), you can't go wrong with this switch!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: BLOCKING SWITCH -- DROPS PACKETS
customer_reviews.text: I connected two (2) set-top TV boxes, and one (1) ATT Uverse router. The router has gigabit ports. The set-top TV boxe have slow (100-megabit) ports. When watching TV on the two units, one of them suffered dropped packets, lost video, and video-restart every few seconds. This was with nothing else on the network. This does not happen with (another brand) of ethernet switch. This switch appears to be blocking one datastream while the other is transmitting a video-packet, and discarding the blocked packet.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great dumb switch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 24 port Gigabit switch for my new home that has cat6 cable throughout. 18 cables needed connection to my router, and using my old 8 port switches seemed unnecessary. I plugged everything in, along with printer and 2 ethernet connections to a local NAS device. Then plugged in my ASUS AC-86U router to control the network and provide internet. So far so good after a month. I get immediate 112 MB/s write speeds to my NAS device from my desktop machine so I'm happy. No network lag thus far.
customer_reviews.author: JGtzTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Best switch I have ever bought for this kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: Best switch I have ever bought for this kind of money. It supports everything: - Multiple link aggregations - VLANs - STP - QoS/DSCP - GUI management - Enable/Disable ports - Settings are per port rather than group/switch - Name ports - In line LEDs - Fanless - Storm control - 16k MTU - IGMP snoopng - Port mirroring - Hardcoding speed/duplex And it does them all very well. Would have expected 100 dollars for an ASIC that had these features. Only thing it isn't is a router (duh).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great for powering an OC200.
customer_reviews.text: I install WiFi systems for large and small complexes. I used this POE Switch to power an OC200 Controller, and 1 EAP225, for a small condo complex. We used 3 EAP225s outdoors. Worked great. I'll be using this system again.
customer_reviews.author: zackdadams

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a home network. I have a modem and router in different rooms so I used this to patch from my modem to my router. All 4 ports of my router were full and now only have 1 cord running to it over 2. Needed 2 more for my TV and tivo so this worked great for the extra ports. Easy install just plug in and good to go. No packet losses or speed reduction.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective VLAN switch
customer_reviews.text: Refers to v4 of this product. I cannot speak to the VLAN 1 issues that affected older versions. I used this to create a "One-armed router" (pfSense) and it worked great. 2 WAN sources, 1 "trunk" connection to router, and then 5 ports available on the switch. Couldn't be happier with how it worked out. All for not very much money, it's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T put a switch on the WLAN side of the router!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about three weeks, then my router started complaining that the ISP's DHCP server was not working. ISP tech support and I reset the modem and router multiple times trying to make it work - finally got the network back without it present - then put it back with downstream net in a new port and got the same error back. The switch might readily have been just fine, but ISP tech support didn't know that you should NEVER put a switch between router and modem and I discover that until after I returned it, so my review is boosted to five stars to give the product benefit of the doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Landis

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy an unmanaged switch due to my father working from home. We could have bought a new modem/router to replace our Xfinity-provided standalone modem, but we weighed out the options and settled on this since our modem is already DOCSIS 3.1 and it's always nice to have a little bit more networking gear/equipment in your home. Price was amazing. Plugged it in, and not even 1 second later I was already reconnected. Very much recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for working from home!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could run internet to my and my son’s offices. The internet signal doesn’t skip a beat and it is great to be hardwired so there is. I worry about my wifi signal dropping at inopportune times. We also had a smart tv that wouldn’t stay connected to the wifi so we wired it as well and didn’t have another problem after that. Highly recommend this product if you are in the market for one it is a great value for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alan Schminke

customer_reviews.title: Does not pass full data rate throughput.
customer_reviews.text: This mini switch did not pass the full data rate on several speed tests. Connecting directly to the router port received full speed as I have greater than 150mbs Internet connect. Connecting through the switch and the data rate would drop to about 60 percent of the available speed compared to being directly connected to the router. I conducted several tests and got the same results, so I returned the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Indy W.

customer_reviews.title: This is what you need to split your Ethernet signal!
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play in less than a minute! You might have to reboot your devices so they recognize the LAN network configuration, but other than that it’s all you need to do. It does need a power adapter, so make sure to plan for that. I have several of these in my house and love how compact, easy to setup, and that I can forget about them. Great for extending your network or hardwiring media devices for fast streaming.
customer_reviews.author: clsteldt

customer_reviews.title: A nice well build basic router.
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it is supposed to. It is small and sturdy with nice options for mounting on a wall or for setting horizontal on a surface. Plug in your ethernet cables into the well labeled ports and you can connect split a connection from your router to multiple devices. I use it to split the ethernet cable that runs through my wall to 3 devices. This lets more of my devices run on ethernet which is faster and more reliable than my wifi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had no WiFi in my garage. I ran a cat 6 line off my router and connected that line to this Poe switch. I then connected an old reprogrammed router to be used as an ap. I also have another cat 6 plugged into the switch that feeds a pc. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Basic and barebones. Much needed to help make the most of our home network
customer_reviews.text: It's a very basic switch. No security; just distributes the bandwidth across different parts of the house. I'm fortunate to have my house internally networked with Cat5 cable running through the house. The punchdown panel was an antique so I installed this switch to accommodate workstations that didn't have wifi. It's doing the job with no issues. It's not taxed too much in our home so I'm not worried about pushing it's limits.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Price

customer_reviews.title: Great switch; solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Solid switch that gets the job done. This product is very high quality, and I installed it in a basement patch panel that needed a strong switch that wouldn’t go down. So far, it worked without any need for being configured! Note: this will give you MORE ports on your router but IS NOT a router alone. You need to have a main router. I used it to add all the wired jacks in the house to the router; you still need to buy you “main” router or have one included from your internet provider
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Very durable heavy duty built, 5 port switcher Box
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand for over 10 years, without any problems, but that switcher box was only 10/100, so time to update went with this box, nice metal, no fan, super quiet, does not run hot. 5 ports, 1 of those ports is the cable from your router, then you can use any of the other 4 ports for all your other internet device. Its does not matter which ports you use, they are all in/out ports. I loose no internet signal strength from using this switcher.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid

customer_reviews.title: First one died within a week, replacement died after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I really like the price point and how compact this is, but unfortunately I have to give this 1 star. I bought one in April 2019 and it died within a week. I only have two POE cameras running on it. Suddenly my cameras weren’t working and I found the POE switch was extremely hot to the touch (fire hazard?). Luckily I was within the return policy and I received a replacement for free. It’s been 5 months since I had the replacement — the same thing happened. The device won’t power on and gets extremely hot when plugged in. Now it’s past the return policy :(
customer_reviews.author: Grant D Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Needed Connection to an XBOX and PS4.
customer_reviews.text: Our Cat6 connection is located on a wall away from where our XBOX and PS4 is located. We bought the Amazon 25ft Cat6 cable and ran that under the baseboard around the room. Then connected the Cat6 to the switch. From the switch we wired both consoles with Cat6 cables and we're gold. Everything running smooth, 400-600MB download and cruisin'. Great switch to have around the house in case.
customer_reviews.author: RedmondIvy

customer_reviews.title: Nice GigE Switch
customer_reviews.text: The price was right for the given feature set. It is made out of steel not plastic and has a good solid weight and feel to it. Performance is good for GigE tests. I've used Dlink, Netgear, and Cisco. This is a quality piece for its price point. If it goes bad I can fall back on the lifetime warranty. Remember the management IP defaults to 192.168.0.1 so be sure to connect directly to it first and set the appropriate managment IP address for your network.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Reliable even in ambient temps up to 105 deg F.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it been reliable and survived a very hot environment. Have this installed in a 1'x1' x 4"metal electrical square housing along with the Ubiquiti Cloud Key pro + DVR controller which runs very hot as well. It survived this years (2019) summer month in Brentwood CA which got to about 101 deg F. Since it is not managed, there is not way to identify if the ports were clocking CRCs, in or out errors. May devices did perform as expected however at 1gig links.
customer_reviews.author: Ed W.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to run a few IP cameras. There's really no lengthy explanation needed. It works. I set them up, connected, and everything is on. I haven't pushed this router to the maximum, I have no need. For the most part, it should handle 4 POE cameras without a problem. Keep in mind that POE items may need to load their own internal software before drawing an IP address and being accessible. My cameras take about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Premium Product at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that just works. No muss, no fuss. I have full bandwidth using a Gocoax Moca 2.5 Ethernet adapter, a Linksys RE7000 wired/wireless extender, a Windows media computer, Yamaha AV receiver, and an Apple TV 4K. I don’t see any problems with bandwidth or interoperability. Everything just works and for less than $20, I’m probably going to buy a 24 POE switch too. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: good_equipment_bad_photographer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gamers/streamers
customer_reviews.text: I'm a gamer/streamer so internet connection is very important to me. My internet connection is just as fast as connecting my ethernet cable directly to the modem. I use this to connect both my xbox, and laptop via ethernet cable. You dont need a more expensive one, this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fabela Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy to Configure and Install.  Works As Expected.
customer_reviews.text: Installed after some simple configuration. The default IP address for enabling/disabling features conflicted with another device, so a few minutes with it plugged directly into a computer with browser was spent before installation. I'm replacing an existing "hub" to improve local inter-device performance. Out with the old, in with the new, and everything works as expected. All in all I'me very satisfied, and recommend that shoppers consider buying this product. I have a collection of the 5- and 8-port units in service at client sites now, with nothing but excellent performance from them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Central Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Literally Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: I ran a 50' CAT7 cable through my crawl space from my AT&T router to my entertainment center. I powered up the TP-Link 5 Port Gigabit Ethernet Network Switch and gave it a minute, then connected the other end of the cable to port #1 and got a green LED. One at a time, using 3' CAT7 cables, I powered up and connected my DirectTV receiver, configured it for wired, then moved on to my PS3, PS4, and Sony HAPZ1ES media server. The ONLY setup was making sure each one was configured for a wired connection, and that was it. It literally was so easy even a cave man could do it!
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but annoying design
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredibly easy to use; simply plug in the power and plug in your various Ethernet jacks into any port! There's no software or settings needed. It's a very low profile design, my only complaint is the power port being on the other side from the Ethernet ports. If you put it on your desk like me, the power cord has to come up under the bottom and into the front. It would have been cleaner if the power was also on the back.
customer_reviews.author: K5cents

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play and off you go
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my IP camera project converting WIFI to ethernet and just had to plug the cables into it, turn on the power and add the cameras to the NVR systems. All works great and no longer have to deal with WIFI signals dropping in and out with every bit of weather or other network interference.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey W.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't play well with existing network (caused internet outages)
customer_reviews.text: Even after connecting to an air-gapped old laptop with RJ45 connector and re-programming it to be DHCP (it ships with a static IP), it caused the whole network to fail due to conflicts with the internet gateway server. NOT an out-of-the-box device. Apparently this has something to do with managed vs. un-managed systems.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Monk

customer_reviews.title: Great performance & value
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a poor quality switch. This one works great and I get the same speeds as when it is bypassed (about 25-30 Mbps). The value is great. The one thing I don't like is the power plug is on the opposite side of the ethernet ports. I think this is dumb and they should be on the same side or at the very least, on adjacent sides. I had to reroute my ethernet cables to face out instead of everything in the back. But it's not a deal breaker for me since I have it put away on a back shelf.
customer_reviews.author: skylander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ethernet hub!
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading my wifi router and getting over 110 Mbps transmitted wirelessly, I discovered that my ethernet cables (running through an older Asanté hub) were only transmitting at about 10 Mbps to the same network. I purchased the TP-Link 5 Port Gigabit switch, plugged in the same ethernet cables, and instantly everything was trasmitting at 110 Mbps, same as my wireless. Easy to set up, good price, fast delivery, and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Terry

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Got this after some research as it was commonly recommended. Plugged it in and it just works. I have gigabit fiber internet and this switch does not present any bottleneck for me. It's not going to handle heavy bandwidth from multiple devices at the same time, but that's not what it's designed for. Had it for just over a month and no disconnects/drops. If anything changes, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: In my entire experience I have always been happy with TP-Link products. I have created home networks using enterly TP-Link products and had no issues. I really recommend this products. Easy to use and easy to set them up.
customer_reviews.author: elreypic

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase! Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link 5 Port Gigabit Ethernet Network Switch. Was hesitant to purchase due to some of the reviews about ports not working or power cable not staying in but I have not had any issues. The switch is quiet, fast, and reliable. However, it’s important to note that you need to connect the switch directly to your router and not your modem. The design of the switch provides the capability to mount to the wall. If you plan on mounting, it does not include any screws to mount. Overall, great purchase and I wish I would have bought this sooner than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I had 1 ethernet cord running up the stairs to my bedroom, because the wifi is weak up there. I didn't want to add more cords, nor switch new devices to wifi. I'll be honest that I didn't know you could get a cheap, small network switch for home use that was also unmanaged; never thought of it before. Now, with still just the 1 cord going upstairs, I have a smart TV, work computer, and home computer, all tied into this switch for a wired-connection strength internet!
customer_reviews.author: SaraB

customer_reviews.title: Switch is dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Switch is defective and no longer working after 3 months. Outside return time frame on Amazon. I called TP-Link and struggled with reps with poor english. They approved replacement, but they want the defective switch shipped to them and will not cover return shipping cost. I am very disappointed. I expected more when the product has a lifetime warranty and was purchased 3 months ago. I will never buy another TP-Link product.
customer_reviews.author: 🙈✨Someone✨🙈

customer_reviews.title: Hangs work when the ambient temperature gets high
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this in my office in my attic. I mounted it to the back of my desk to keep all the cabling organized, so I do appreciate that feature. Unfortunately, when the summer heat sets in, my attic gets hot. I noticed that this device would hang frequently when the temperature got about 85 F or hotter. Unplugging and restoring power would reset it and it would work for a while. Ultimately, moved it to a room with AC and it's rock solid there.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Good to go and exactly what I wanted and expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my in-laws as I’m the family technician and with the gift of a new mesh router, this provided the additional ports needed for wired clients. So far so good; working as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play!
customer_reviews.text: We switched ISPs this week so our old cable modem/router was no longer usable - BUT we used the wired ports on it for our TV / console connections. Found this bargain ($14.99!) switch and it took all of a minute to plug everything in. Works like a charm - I think opening the package took longer than setting it up - just connect to new ISP’s access point and done.
customer_reviews.author: A.I.

customer_reviews.title: Bought to replace my Cisco 8 port 1GB
customer_reviews.text: I thought that my Cisco switch was having issues since I was not seeing my full speed from Spectrum on my Mac. So I bought this new switch. Works fine...but didn't solve my speed issue. Turned out it was Chrome not the switch. Oh well, I can always use it for another room. :). Small and compact though so will fit on desk behind you monitor, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Madman With A Camera

customer_reviews.title: Solves The Problem Of One LAN Connection Needing To Be Used By Multiple AV Components
customer_reviews.text: This TP-Link, 5 port Ethernet "powered" network splitter solved my long existing problem with linking 4 AV components to one single LAN connection. I am now able to connect an Apple TV, Apple MiniMac Computer, Ultra Blue Ray player and Ocean Internet Radio Tuner to the same LAN connection. Although there are 5 ports on the switch, 1 port is used for the "in-coming" LAN cable - leaving only 4 switched connections available for other devices.
customer_reviews.author: CityGuyTX

customer_reviews.title: Top Speed 115MB/S
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to review this wonderful, fast, simple plug and play switch. Buy it without thinking it's worth it. I bought the one without VLAN feature. I had 2 , 100Mb/s old dlink switches as the copy process was slooooooooooow from and to my NAS server max was 11-12/Mb/s. Decided to give this cheap 1000Mb/s switch and it's working great with write speed of 100+MB/S. Hope it will last couple of year before dying. This is the best and cheap gigabit ethernet switch i came across so far (without VLAN feature)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up and it has worked perfectly since. I was using a inside wall MOCA system in my house but it got to the point that any little signal flicker in my feed to the house would cause the MOCA switch to reset itself and cause lag and interruption. (I'm sure you all have seen equipment do it's setup light dance.) Since running a direct Cat 6 feed from my router/modem and feeding 4 devices off of this switch the connection is perfect. If there is any system flicker from outside it is unnoticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Version concerns
customer_reviews.text: TPLink website lists hardware version 1.20 as the most recent hardware version available - What I received from this seller was hardware version 1.0. :( Considering concerns regarding cyber and having the most updated versions to protect networks - I was surprised that older hardware versions are being shipped. Not happy - But stuck with a situation were I have to get this installed. :(
customer_reviews.author: BillyBobBooooooJohnson

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: i upgraded to a tplink 24 unmanaged from a trendnet 16 unmanaged and they are almost the same...This switch works great and is plug in play but the trendnet leds would use different colors for speeds and this switch just uses green..Kind of petty but i like to know what my clients are doing..Other than that this is a great add on to my shack...
customer_reviews.author: Len Ricupero

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Switch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an Ubiquity access point device and I wanted something really compact. I found this switch. When I received it it looked even smaller and more compact. I like it a lot and my new access point is now up and running and also now my kids have hard wire internet as well thru a network cable that is connected straight to this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Mister M

product_meta.title: TP-Link 5 Port Gigabit Ethernet Network Switch (TL-SG105) - Ethernet Splitter | Plug & Play | Fanless | Sturdy Metal w/ Shielded Ports | Traffic Optimization | Unmanaged | Lifetime Protection
product_meta.description:
Capacity:5 Port| Model:Unmanaged

WHAT THIS PRODUCT DOES
TP-LINK’s TL-SG105 provides an easy way to expand your wired network. All 5 ports support Auto-MDI/MDIX, eliminating the need to worry about what type of cable to use. Featuring full duplex mode, the device can process data at a rate of up to 2000Mbps, making it an ideal choice for expanding your high performance wired network. Moreover, with innovative energy-efficient technology, the TL-SG105 can save energy up to 65%.

KEY FEATURES
GIGABIT SWITCH
Featured with 5 10/100/1000Mbps ports, the TL-SG105 enables ultra-fast wired connectivity, enabling instant large files transferring.

STEEL HOUSING
The TL-SG105 is housed in a compact steel case for longer life span. With the desktop or wall-mounting design, you can place the device wherever it’s convenient.

EASY TO USE
TThe auto features of this gigabit switch make installation plug and play and hassle-free. No configuring is required. Auto MDI/MDIX eliminate the need for crossover cables. Auto-negotiation on each port senses the link speed of a network.

GO GREEN WITH YOUR ETHERNET
The TL-SG105 features the latest innovative energy-efficient technologies that can save power up to 65%. It automatically adjusts power consumption according to the link status and cable length to limit the carbon footprint of your network.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Support IEEE 802.3x flow control for Full Duplex mode and backpressure for Half Duplex mode
 * Support QoS (IEEE 802.1p)
 * Non-blocking switching architecture that forwards and filters packets at full wire-speed for maximum throughput
 * 10Gbps Switching Capacity, 2K MAC address table, 9KB Jumbo Frame, 1MB Buffer Memory
 * Auto-MDI/MDIX eliminates the need for crossover cables
 * Support MAC address auto-learning and auto-aging
 * Auto-negotiation ports allow smart integration between 10Mbps, 100Mbps, and 1000Mbps devices
 * Fanless desgin to keep a quiet environment
 * Support 100-240V power supply

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * 5-Port Gigabit Switch
 * Power Adapter
 * User Guide

TP-LINK UNMANAGED SWITCHES SERIES 
Which Unmanaged Switch is Right for Me? TL-SG1005D TL-SG1008D TL-SG105 TL-SG108 TL-SG1016D TL-SG1024D TL-SG1016 TL-SG1024 Product Name 5-Port Gigabit Desktop Switch 8-Port Gigabit Desktop Switch 5-Port Gigabit Desktop Switch 8-Port Gigabit Desktop Switch 16-Port Gigabit Desktop/Rackmount Switch 24-Port Gigabit Desktop/Rackmount Switch 16-Port Gigabit Rackmount Switch 24-Port Gigabit Rackmount Switch Case Material Plastic Plastic Steel Steel Steel Steel Steel Steel Port Number 5 8 5 8 16 24 16 24 Size Desktop Desktop Desktop Desktop 13-inch 13-inch 19-inch 19-inch QoS - - ✓ ✓ - - - - IGMP Snooping - - ✓ - - - - - AUTO MDI/MDIX ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ IEEE 802.3X Flow Control ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Power Saving ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Plug and Play ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Interface Available: 8 x 10/100/1000Mbps RJ45 Ports, AUTO Negotiation/AUTO MDI/MDIX; Internal Memory: 1.5Mb; Protocols Supported: IEEE 802.3i IEEE 802.3u IEEE 802.3ab IEEE 802.3af , IEEE 802.3x IEEE 802.1q IEEE 802.1p; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows for running Utility
feature_bullets: PLUG AND PLAY : Easy setup with no configuration or no software needed.
ETHERNET SPLITTER Connectivity to your router or modem router for additional wired connections (LAPTOP, gaming console, Printer, etc).
5 Ports GIGABIT ETHERNET 5 10/100/1000 Mbps Gigabit auto negotiation RJ45 ports greatly expand network capacity.
STURDY METAL CASE: Fanless Quiet Design, DeskTop or wall mounting Design. Operating Temperature: 0 degree Celsius ~40 degree Celsius (32 degree Fahrenheit ~104 degree Fahrenheit).
Reliable IEEE 802. 3x flow Control provides reliable data transfer; Max Heat Dissipation: 8. 3 BTU/h.
TRAFFIC OPTIMIZATION 802. 1p and DSCP QoS enable smooth latency sensitive traffic such as voice and video.
UP to 84 percentage power saving automatically adjusts power consumption according to the link status and cable length.
AUTO NEGOTIATION Suppots Auto MDI/MDIX, eliminating the need for crossover cables.
Limited lifetime and unlimited 24/7 technical support for free.
